properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Markwood, between Bridle Track Road and Harrington Track
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Markwood, between Bridle Track Road and Harrington Track.
  • There is a bushfire at Markwood that is not yet under control.
  • Go to VicEmergency for other warnings current for this fire.
  • This Advice replaces the Advice Message issued at 4.39pm.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Keep the Snow Road clear to allow emergency vehicles access for firefighting 
  • The following road is closed: Snow Road and Carboor Everton Road, to Whorouly Road, Whorouly and will remain closed 5/12/2025.
  • Firefighters are responding to this fire.
  •  Further road closures are proposed please check the VicTraffic website (Vic Traffic) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 0600 or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information is being issued for Myola.
  • There is a grassfire at Creek View.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • This Community Information message replaces the advice message issued at 5:29 PM.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last message issued for this fire

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au.
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app.
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following service can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Services on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Markwood, Whorouly. 
  • The a bushfire that started at Snow Road, Markwood is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling from Snow Road in a south-easterly direction towards Whorouly-Bobinawarrah Rd. 
  • The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
  • It is not safe to return to the area. Be aware of potential dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do:  
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family. 
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. Remember to: 
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Impacts in your area: 
  • The following road is closed: Snow Road and Carboor Everton Road, to Whorouly Road, Whorouly and will remain closed 5/12/2025.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.   

The next update is expected by 0200 or as the situation changes.   

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.   
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
properties.text:
WATCH & ACT - BUSHFIRE - Threat is Reduced - Monitor Conditions
Incident Location: Snow Road, Markwood
Issue Date: Thursday 04 December 2025, 10:13 pm
Next Update: Friday 05 December 2025, 02:20 am

More details at http://emergency.vic.gov.au/respond/#!/warning/38552/moreinfo

This Watch and Act message is being issued for Markwood, Whorouly. 
- The a bushfire that started at Snow Road, Markwood is not yet under control. 
- The bushfire is travelling from Snow Road in a south-easterly direction towards Whorouly-Bobinawarrah Rd. 
- The spread of the bushfire has slowed for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act. 
- It is not safe to return to the area. Be aware of potential dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.


The threat is reduced, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Patchewollock.
  • There is a bushfire in Bronzewing State Forest, near Moloney Road that is not yet under control.
  •  The bushfire is travelling from Baring South in a south-easterly direction towards Hopetoun - Walpeup Road.
  • A wind change is expected around 9pm. This will cause the fire to change directions towards Patchewollock. 
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Impacts in your area:
  • Firefighters are responding to this fire.
  • Smoke will be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • Bulldozers and aircraft are operating in the area.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 05/12/2025 02:20 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service for assistance and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

  • There is a bushfire at Markwood that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling from Snow Rd in a south-easterly direction towards Whorouly-Bobinawarrah Rd. 
  • Go to VicEmergency for other warnings current for this fire.

There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Neilborough, Raywood.
  • There is a bushfire at Raywood-Elmore Rd, Raywood that is under control.
  •  The bushfire is travelling from the Raywood-Elmore Road in a southerly direction towards Talbot Road. 
  • This Advice replaces the Watch and Act message issued at 2:33 PM.
  • There is currently no threat to communities, but you should continue to stay informed and monitor conditions.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Keep the roads clear so emergency services can respond.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Emergency services will remain in the area.
  • Smoke may visible from nearby communities and roads. 
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 05/12/2025 03:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.webHeadline: A fire has started There is no immediate danger. Stay up to date in case the situation changes

Today, Fri, 5 Dec 2025 has been declared a day of Total Fire Ban in the Mallee district(s) of Victoria.  No fires can be lit or be allowed to remain alight in the open air from 12:01 AM on Fri, 5 Dec 2025 until 11:59 PM Fri, 5 Dec 2025.
